comment.author: 92803452@N04
comment._content:
Trinidad and Tobago / Port of Spain / Port-of-Spain 

Where pensioners get paid, When I was 21 years of age, I remember having to take my first cheque to be cashed, here, in Port of Spain.

comment.author: 29737374@N03
comment._content: Treasury Building on Independence Square (formerly Marine Square). Also the site of the Emancipation Proclamation of 1834. The Emancipation Bill was presented in Parliament by Thomas Buxton in 1833 and the Act came into effect on August 1, 1834.  On August 1, 1985, Trinidad and Tobago became the first country in the world to declare a national holiday to commemorate the abolition of slavery.
